intro: Aegoseris leontodontoides, commonly known as the leopard's head, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. It is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats, where it adds visual interest with its unique foliage. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun and minimal water.
